summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2005 CADILLAC STS.  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH THE VEHICLE STALLED WITHOUT WARNING. THE CONTACT STATED THE ENGINE WAS RUNNING, BUT  THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT ACCELERATE.  THE CONTACT PULLED OVER AND SHUT THE VEHICLE OFF.  THE CONTACT WAS ABLE TO RESTART THE VEHICLE ,ONLY TO HAVE IT STALL AGAIN. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO A AUTO REPAIR STOP FOR A DIAGNOSTIC TEST. THE TEST RESULTS DID NOT READ ANY CODES.  THE CONTACT STATED  THAT AFTER RE-FUELING THE VEHICLE, THE FUEL GAUGE WOULD NOT READ THE CORRECT FUEL AMOUNT AND THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT RESTART. THE CONTACT NOTICE A NHTSA CAMPAIGN I.D. NUMBER  06V020000 (FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY) AND THEN CALLED THE MANUFACTURER.  THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THE VIN NUMBER WAS INCLUDED INCLUDED IN THE RECALL.  THE CONTACT STATED THE VEHICLE HAD EXPERIENCED THE SAME FAIULRES  STATED IN THE RECALL.  THE CONTACT STATED THE VEHICLE WAS UNSAFE TO DRIVE.  THE CONTACT FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 60,000.
